text: Joseph Taiwo (born 24 August 1959) is a retired Nigerian athlete who competed in the triple jump. His personal best was 17.22 metres, achieved in June 1988 in Bauchi. This ranks him second among Nigerian triple jumpers, behind Ajayi Agbebaku, and fifth in Africa, behind Ndabazinhle Mdhlongwa, Agbebaku, Khotso Mokoena and Andrew Owusu.GBR Athletics website He is the father of American decathlete Jeremy Taiwo. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1984 |African Championships |Rabat, Morocco |bgcolor=gold|1st |Triple jump |17.19 m |- |Olympic Games |Los Angeles, United States |9th |Triple jump |16.64 m |- |rowspan=3|1987 |World Indoor Championships |Indianapolis, United States |6th |Triple jump |16.65 m |- |World Championships |Rome, Italy |5th |Triple jump |17.29 m |- |All-Africa Games |Nairobi, Kenya |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Triple jump |16.90 m |- |1988 |Olympic Games |Seoul, South Korea |9th |Triple jump |16.46 m |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:Nigerian male triple jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Nigeria Category:African Games silver medalists for Nigeria Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1987 All-Africa Games Category:African Games competitors for Nigeria
title: Joseph Taiwo
